The physical presence of the steel: beam cross in the World Trade Center rubble, which was discovered two days after the 9/11 attacks and provided comfort and faith to many individuals.
The numerous ceremonies: prayer vigils, and pilgrimages held at the site of the WTC cross in the weeks and months following its discovery, demonstrating its significance as a symbol of hope, faith, and healing.
The support from various groups to incor: highlighting its importance as a memorial element.
The opposition from the American Atheist: led by their president Ellen Johnson, who argued that public funds should not be used to construct any religious memorial and that including the cross would insult non-Christians and those who do not believe in a deity.
